ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the dawn when it grows bright,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The morning when it is unveiled,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the day when it dawns (with its radiance),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the morning, when it spreads light.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And by the dawn when it brightens.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the daybreak when it shines;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and the dawn when it is white,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the dawn when it shineth forth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By the dawn when it lightens!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the morning when it brighteneth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: By the dawn when it brightens!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And by the Dawn as it shineth forth,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the dawn when it brightens,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and the morning when it appears,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the morning as it lights up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the morning when it brightens,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:34] And by the dawn when it appears!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And the dawn when it shineth forth.
